Motors¶

class gamegine.reference.motors.MotorConfig[source]¶

Stores the configuration of a motor, including motor specification and power configuration.

Parameters:

  • motor (MotorSpecification) – The motor specification of the motor.

  • power (PowerConfig) – The power configuration of the motor.

__init__(motor, power)¶
Parameters:

  • motor (MotorSpecification)

  • power (PowerConfig)

Return type:

None

Return type:

Returns the maximum torque of the motor.

Returns:

Return type:

get_torque_at(speed)[source]¶

Calculates the torque output of the motor at a given speed.

Parameters:

speed (Omega) – The speed at which to calculate the torque.

Returns:

The torque output of the motor at the given speed.

Return type:

Torque

class gamegine.reference.motors.MotorSpecification[source]¶

Stores the specifications of a motor, including weight, free speed, stall torque, stall current, free current, kT, kV, and max voltage.

Parameters:

  • weight (MassMeasurement) – The weight of the motor.

  • free_speed (Omega) – The free speed of the motor.

  • stall_torque (Torque) – The stall torque of the motor.

  • stall_current (CurrentMeasurement) – The stall current of the motor.

  • free_current (CurrentMeasurement) – The free current of the motor.

  • kT (ComplexMeasurement) – The torque constant of the motor.

  • kV (ComplexMeasurement) – The velocity constant of the motor.

  • maxVoltage (ElectricPot) – The maximum voltage of the motor.

__init__(weight, free_speed, stall_torque, stall_current, free_current, kT, kV, maxVoltage=12.0 m^2.0 * kg/s^3.0 * A)¶
Parameters:

  • weight (MassMeasurement)

  • free_speed (Omega)

  • stall_torque (Torque)

  • stall_current (CurrentMeasurement)

  • free_current (CurrentMeasurement)

  • kT (ComplexMeasurement)

  • kV (ComplexMeasurement)

  • maxVoltage (ElectricPot)

Return type:

None

get_torque_at(speed, max_current, max_stator_current=0.0 A)[source]¶

Calculates the torque output of the motor at a given speed, with a given current limit.

Parameters:

  • speed (Omega) – The speed at which to calculate the torque.

  • max_current (CurrentMeasurement) – The maximum current limit of the motor.

  • max_stator_current (CurrentMeasurement, optional) – The maximum stator current limit of the motor. Defaults to Ampere(0).

Returns:

The torque output of the motor at the given speed.

Return type:

Torque

class gamegine.reference.motors.PowerConfig[source]¶

Stores the power configuration of a motor, including supply current limit, stator current limit, and max power percentage.

Parameters:

  • supply_current_limit (CurrentMeasurement) – The supply current limit of the motor.

  • stator_current_limit (CurrentMeasurement) – The stator current limit of the motor.

  • max_power_percentage (float, optional) – The maximum power percentage of the motor. Defaults to 1.0.

__init__(supply_current_limit=40.0 A, stator_current_limit=0.0 A, max_power_percentage=1.0)¶
Parameters:

  • supply_current_limit (CurrentMeasurement)

  • stator_current_limit (CurrentMeasurement)

  • max_power_percentage (float)

Return type:

None

Returns the output gear of the gear system.

Return type:

Gear

class gamegine.reference.gearing.GearSeries[source]¶

Class used to store the gear ratio of a gear system. Used in order to create compound gears. To apply the gear ratio to a value, multiply or divide the value by the GearSeries object.

Parameters:

  • input_gear (Gear) – The input gear of the gear system.

  • output_gear (Gear) – The output gear of the gear system.

  • ratio (float) – The gear ratio of the gear system.

__init__(input_gear, output_gear, ratio=None)[source]¶
Parameters:

  • input_gear (Gear)

  • output_gear (Gear)

Return type:

None

get_input_gear()[source]¶

Returns the input gear of the gear system.

Returns:

The input gear of the gear system.

Return type:

Gear

get_output_gear()[source]¶

Returns the output gear of the gear system.

Returns:

The output gear of the gear system.

Return type:

Gear

get_ratio()[source]¶

Returns the gear ratio of the gear system.

Returns:

The gear ratio of the gear system.

Return type:

float

class gamegine.reference.gearing.MK4I[source]¶

Class for storing the gear ratios of the MK4I Swerve.

Drive Train¶

class gamegine.reference.swerve.SwerveConfig[source]¶

Dataclass used to store the configuration of a swerve drive.

Parameters:

  • module (SwerveModule) – The configuration of the swerve module.

  • top_left_offset (Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]) – The offset of the top left module from the center of the robot.

  • top_right_offset (Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]) – The offset of the top right module from the center of the robot.

  • bottom_left_offset (Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]) – The offset of the bottom left module from the center of the robot.

  • bottom_right_offset (Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, :class:`SpatialMeasurement) – The offset of the bottom right module from the center of the robot.

__init__(module, top_left_offset=(-13.0 in, 13.0 in), top_right_offset=(13.0 in, 13.0 in), bottom_left_offset=(-13.0 in, -13.0 in), bottom_right_offset=(13.0 in, -13.0 in))¶
Parameters:

  • module (SwerveModule)

  • top_left_offset (Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement])

  • top_right_offset (Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement])

  • bottom_left_offset (Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement])

  • bottom_right_offset (Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement])

Return type:

None

class gamegine.reference.swerve.SwerveModule[source]¶

Dataclass used to store the configuration of a swerve module.

Parameters:

  • drive_motor (MotorConfig) – The motor configuration for the drive motor.

  • drive_gear_ratio (GearSeries) – The gear ratio for the drive motor.

  • steer_motor (MotorConfig) – The motor configuration for the steer motor.

  • steer_gear_ratio (GearSeries) – The gear ratio for the steer motor.

  • wheel (Wheel) – The wheel configuration for the module.

__init__(drive_motor, drive_gear_ratio, steer_motor, steer_gear_ratio, wheel=<factory>)¶
Parameters:

  • drive_motor (MotorConfig)

  • drive_gear_ratio (GearSeries)

  • steer_motor (MotorConfig)

  • steer_gear_ratio (GearSeries)

  • wheel (Wheel)

Return type:

None

class gamegine.reference.wheels.Tread[source]¶

Dataclass used to store the coefficient of friction of a wheel tread.

Parameters:

  • coefficientOfFriction (float) – The coefficient of friction of the tread.

  • sideCoF (float, optional) – The coefficient of friction of the side of the tread. Defaults to 0.

__init__(coefficientOfFriction, sideCoF=0.0)¶
Parameters:

  • coefficientOfFriction (float)

  • sideCoF (float)

Return type:

None

class gamegine.reference.wheels.TreadDB[source]¶

Class used to store the coefficient of friction of various wheel treads available in the FRC game. Including different types of VexPro wheels, Colson Performa wheels, AM wheels, AM FIRST wheels, AM Stealth wheels, AM Mecanum wheels, and AM Dualie Omni wheels.

class gamegine.reference.wheels.Wheel[source]¶

Dataclass used to store the diameter of a wheel.

Parameters:

  • diameter (SpatialMeasurement) – The diameter of the wheel.

  • tread (Tread) – The tread of the wheel.

  • width (SpatialMeasurement, optional) – The width of the wheel. Defaults to Inch(1).

  • mass (MassMeasurement, optional) – The mass of the wheel. Defaults to Pound(0.3).

__init__(diameter, tread, width=1.0 in, mass=0.3 lb)¶
Parameters:

  • diameter (SpatialMeasurement)

  • tread (Tread)

  • width (SpatialMeasurement)

  • mass (MassMeasurement)

Return type:

None

The circumference of the wheel.

Returns:

The coefficient of friction of the wheel tread.
